title: Re: ehhehehe... yeah:
content:
You got that idea from the fact that 22/7 is what is known as the 'classical approximation' to pi. It was used for thousands of years in planning to simplify the calculations in architectural plans. It is equal to 3.142857, a pretty good approximation [Error less than 1 part in 300] A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Yeah
content:
It's the simplest "classical approximation" to pi. The easiest one anyways... it's uses the smallest numbers for the numerator and denominator. Another famous one is 355/113 (that's the one the Chinese commonly used for more exact measurement of circles).

Really, if you know the first 10 digits, that's plenty. I believe you can determine the circumference of the Earth to the nearest meter with just those.
